column2: NEW MEXICO DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column8: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.

column2: 2. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 3. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you have put your turn signal on.
column8: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column10: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 4. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
5. When passing another vehicle, before turning back into the right-hand lane drivers should wait until they can see the vehicle they are passing in the rearview mirror.
6. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
7. This road sign means:
8. Some roadway surfaces are more slippery during certain times or at certain places. Which of the following is more likely to be slippery on cold, wet days?
9. To keep the driver behind you at a safe distance you should:
column4: drive 5 MPH slower than the car behind.
column6: drive 5 MPH faster than the car behind.

column2: 10. A yellow arrow means:
column4: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column6: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
12. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.
column6: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
column8: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.

column2: 13. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
14. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column6: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 15. To practice defensive driving you should:
column6: look well ahead of your vehicle and be aware of developing traffic situations around you.
column8: always leave yourself a way out.

column2: 16. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column8: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 17. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column6: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 18. When driving in foggy weather, drivers should:
column6: put their lights on high beam.
column8: put their lights on low beam.

column2: 19. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column4: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.
column10: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
21. This sign means:
22. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
23. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.
column6: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.
column8: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.
column10: you must stop again at the stop sign.

column2: 24. Before entering an intersection, drivers should look:
25. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column6: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column8: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column10: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
